name: frowningly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
while frowning (= bringing your eyebrows together so that there are lines on your face above your eyes) to show you are worried or not pleased with something: He regarded me frowningly. "You were there when they received the news, weren't you?" She frowningly pushed the papers about her desk, trying to work out why the figures didn't add up.
More examplesFewer examplesHe often becomes frowningly silent for long periods.He looked closely at every inch of her face, like a jeweller frowningly examining a precious object.My friends looked at me frowningly and I started to realize what I'd agreed to do.
